result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett L. Krajewski

records.addlTxt:
1:43 PM/ RM 203. Defendant Brett L. Krajewski in court.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak appeared in court via zoom for Brett L. Krajewski.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Atty Babiak has received a copy of the criminal complaint, waives reading and notes Def. has waived time limits for P.H. Atty Babiak requests status conference. Def. continues to wish to waive time limits on P.H. State has complied with victims rights. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM Defendant Brett L. Krajewski in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history and notes Def. has qualified with PD Office, reviews counsel report. Court questions if Def. still wishes to attain counsel. Def. confirms. Court feels Def. should have an Atty. and questions if Def. would like to have a P.H. within 20 days. Def. denies and waives time limits. State is in compliance with victim rights. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:41 PM Defendant Brett L. Krajewski in court. Prosecuting attorney Kelly L Hays in court for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. has contacted PD office and is still waiting for counsel. Def. still wishes to have counsel. Court finds good cause to go past time limits.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:33 PM Defendant Brett L. Krajewski in court.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Def. has been informed of charges and was going to contact PD office. Def. does qualify for an attorney and court finds reason to go past time limits via Nhia Lee Standards. State is in compliance with victim rights.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brett L. Krajewski
Current: N5361 Church Road, Deerbrook, WI 54424 United States  (Effective: 08-19-2022)
Prior: 5361 Church Road, Deerbrook, WI 54424
No contact with victim 1 or victim 2 or their properties.

11:17 AM Defendant Brett L. Krajewski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is going to contact Public Defender. State gives bail/bond recommendation with conditions No contact with victim 1 or victim 2 or their property.  Court orders $2,500 Signature bond with condition No contact with victim 1 or victim 2 or their properties. State has complied with victim rights.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
